posts.content: In your first example, make sure to use the same URL : https://api.thingspeak.com/update and then load the parameters using a tool like poster or postman.

posts.content: Did you use firebug or similar tools to examine the network traffic?  Perhaps poster isnt formatting things properly?

posts.content: Hello. I'm experiencing problems with data updates. I know about channel limit, but is there any IP limit? I have a timer in code that makes update every 15 sec. However points plotted very randomly without nay pattern. What could it be?
posts.author: Dmitriy

posts.content: There is no IP based limit on uploading data. Is your device connected to the network using wired ethernet, or using a 3G or similar data connection?To troubleshoot, you could set up your code to also send you an email on every point. If you get your email but your data point does not  get updated on ThingSpeak it could provide some insights on what is going on.
posts.author: Vinod

posts.content: That is not normal behavior. Can you send your channel number to support@thingspeak.com and we will look into it. Thanks.

posts.content: Thanks Hans, I will do and post the solution here.

posts.content: My device posts data to one field in a channel every 6 hours (or with a larger period, if the device can't connect to Internet).However I see only one (last) point on the graph (refer to Field 5 of the channel 124005):If the channel was open in a browser before the posting, the points get connected:However this effect disappears after the page is refreshed.All graphs are created with (almost) default settings, and I expect they can show up to 60 points.How can I tell the graph to connect sparse data points properly?
posts.author: Anton_K

posts.content: All of your data in Field 5 looks to be null... https://thingspeak.com/channels/124005/field/5.jsonAre you writing data back to this channel at different times? If so, fields that are not being written to get a null. You should use separate channels when you are sending data at different speeds.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: Yes, data for Field 5 is being posted at different speed if compared to other fields...Thanks for the hint!I thought I could make it with a single channel. I'll try to redesign my solution...
posts.author: Anton_K

posts.content: Hello,I have IOT device that measures some sensors every 5 minutes and sending all the data just after 2 hours (24 messages).The problem is when I'm trying to send to the dashboard message after message in less than 15 seconds between them you just ignore it. I'm using GSM and to save energy I'm connecting to the network just every 2 hours.In total the average time of the messages is 5 min although all of them coming in the same minute.What can I do?BTW, I'm sending also the 'created_at' as a timestamp - this is working well.
posts.author: itayd

posts.content: The best way to handle this situation is to write your updates using multiple channels. Since you have multiple things to update in separate requests, having separate channels makes sense. If you need to combine the results into one channel again, you could write some MATLAB analysis code to read from your channels and write to a new one as separate fields.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: To add 12 channels just for that and then make a special MATLAB script to handle that? It sounds not really elegant solution...Do you have any other solution?
posts.author: itayd

posts.content: Are you able to write the data all at the same time? Each channel has 8 fields, but we intend for you to write them at the same time. If that is not possible, then each request should go into separate channels. Otherwise you will have nulls in the other fields.
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: itayd said ... I have IOT device that measures some sensors every 5 minutes and sending all the data just after 2 hours (24 messages). ... To send all accumulated data your device has to be online for 6 minutes (= 360 seconds = 24 msgs * 15 seconds).I guess, the bulk update won't be implemented soon for ThingSpeak API...Have you found a solution for your task with massive update?
posts.author: Anton_K

posts.content: Is there a standard way or a easy way to choose to and from dates for example to look at one day last month.Can a matlab chart be dynamic updated from a input field ?
posts.author: birkebjerg

posts.content: re: Is there a standard way or a easy way to choose to and from dates for example to look at one day last month.You can customize the visualizations using the pencil icon on the visualization on your channels page. Setting the 'days' to 30 will show you the graph for the last 30 days. If you want to look at a specific day of the month, you can use thingSpeakRead with a DateRange with your day of interest in a MATLAB Analysis app to get the data. If you're looking for a plot, combine the thingSpeakRead with a thingSpeakPlot, for example, in a MATLAB Visualization app.re: Can a matlab chart be dynamic updated from a input field ?The MATLAB code in your MATLAB Visualization app can pull data from a channel using thingSpeakRead. The plots generated using thingSpeakPlot by your MATLAB Visualization app are updated when the MATLAB code is run.
posts.author: Vinod

posts.content: I really don't know much about MATLAB chart functionality. I hope you should Google it.  Alvin Park
posts.author: alvinpark

However in GitHub not all the images display in some files, and in others they don't display at all. These images are not linked, just reside inside the source files.

Thanks.  I also am using chrome,  the page had been modified, i had reduced the number of data elements to plot to 60 per field/graph, while the default setting was more like 6000 (x6 =36000 elements plotted live..), reducing the source set to 60 from 6000 didnt effect the then current chrome session which was still laggy, but on returning after catching your reply i checked again to find it was a-ok.. So I have run through resetting each graph to present the whole data set  and that does indeed appear to slow down the chrome chrome session...   i am recording readings every 20 seconds or so much faster a rate than the intended 'finished' project will read/log which will be 1-2 times per hour.. probably recording an aggregate/mean value.. or no doubt when i have done the 'required reading' i will find data tools available to sample larger data sets for plotting..  thanks for the input

posts.content: HiExcuse me for my English.How I can export data for specified time range?For example I need to download my channel data from 2015/5/1  to 2016/5/1 ,how I can do this?I read this topic:http://community.thingspeak.com/forum/general/export-data-in-time-range/But it does not worked for me,because my channel is private.Please help me!
posts.author: tceel

posts.content: The API documentation shows how to get a channel feed.  If you add '&api_key=YOUR_API_KEY' to the end of the URL in the 4th post of the topic you will be able to access private channels.However there is a limit of 8000 points per call so doing it this way can be tedious if there is a lot of points.The other way is to download the entire channel contents using the 'data export' button on the website and extract the required date range using your favourite text editor,spreadsheet or stats package.
posts.author: rw950431

posts.content: There were some others complaining about the same thing I remember (but I couldnt find the posting).  There was some talk about downloads timing out internally.can you try it at a different time of day to see if the servers are less loaded then? Otherwise you may have to use a script to automate calling the API for each 8000 points.  I have some python code I used for a similar service (Xively) that might be useful as an example to write your own.
posts.author: rw950431

posts.content: Thank you.I'll try it.I will be appreciated if you could share your script.Thank you again
posts.author: tceel

posts.content: I had some fun getting this to work because of a quirk in the Thingspeak API (when you specify start,end and results parameters you get the last data in the time range rather than the first). https://gist.github.com/rw950431/d4118dea9f786a4bdc0fcc860f2cb84e Not overly tested, so may break if unusual things happen.
posts.author: rw950431

posts.content: My problem with 3g connection remained unanswered. I analyzed the library and found that the problem here:if(!this->client->print(URL))Few messages from UART:ts::readRaw (channelNumber: xxxxxx readAPIKey: xxxxxxxx URLSuffix: '/fields/1/last') Connect to api.thingspeak.com ...Success. GET '/channels/xxxxxxxxx/fields/1/last' URL Failed // - This line I added myself to the library for specify the problem // ReadRaw abort - disconnected.status -304: Timeout waiting for server to respondCan somebody advise how to solve this?This problem is actual only when I using 3g router.
posts.author: pilnikov

posts.content: It appears data transfer using your 3g router is slow enough to cause a timeout. 'status -304: Timeout waiting for server to respond'. If you are using the library from here: https://github.com/mathworks/thingspeak-arduino ,try modifying the TIMEOUT_MS_SERVERRESPONSE value to a larger value in thingspeak.h.
posts.author: Vinod
